section.heading: Prior authorization requirements and restrictions.

para.text: A utilization review entity may only require prior authorization for a covered health care service based on a determination of medical necessity for different care or that the proposed care is experimental or investigational in nature.
A utilization review entity may not require prior authorization:
Based solely on the cost of a covered health care service; provided, that:
Not Funded.
Not Funded.
For the provision of medication assisted treatment; or
For pre-hospital transportation or for the provision of emergency health care services, including emergency health care services to screen and stabilize an enrollee.
A utilization review entity shall:

Post its current prior authorization requirements and restrictions, including formulary ("prior authorization requirements"), on its website, in a manner accessible to the general public without the need to create an account;
Email or provide a hard copy of the prior authorization requirements to an enrollee, representative, or health care provider upon request by telephone or in writing; and
Provide information on its prior authorization requirements, upon request, to an enrollee, representative, or health care provider over the telephone.
Prior authorization requirements shall:
Be described in detail and easily understandable language;
Include any written clinical criteria;
Include a comprehensive listing of all drugs that require prior authorization; and
Include the process for submitting, and standards for considering, including evidence-based guidelines, where possible, requests for:
Prior authorization approval;
Reauthorization of a prior grant of approval; and
An appeal of an adverse determination.

If a utilization review entity intends to amend or replace its prior authorization requirements, any changes to the requirements shall not be effective until the utilization review entity's website has been updated to reflect the new requirements.

section.codify:annotation: Applicability of D.C. Law 25-100: § 301 of D.C. Law 25-100 provided that the creation of subsection (a)(2)(A)(i) and (ii) of this section by § 102 of D.C. Law 25-100 is subject to the inclusion of the law’s fiscal effect in an approved budget and financial plan. Therefore that amendment has not been implemented.
